title: How the ‘Donroe Doctrine’ Reinforces Xi’s Vision of Power in Asia
summary: The U.S. assault on Venezuela points to a world where big powers seek to call the shots in their regions, an idea Beijing knows well.

title: Stephen Miller Asserts U.S. Has Right to Take Greenland
summary: In a CNN interview, the Trump aide also echoed the president’s intent to run Venezuela as he laid out a case for the United States to control weaker states by flexing its military might.

title: U.S. Attack to Seize Greenland Would End NATO, Danish Prime Minister Says
summary: Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen said President Trump’s threats “should be taken seriously” and warned against action to annex the semiautonomous Danish territory.

title: A Jan. 6 Rioter Returned to the Capitol Seeking Forgiveness
summary: Pamela Hemphill, who said she rejected President Trump’s pardon for her role in the Jan. 6, 2021, attack, apologized to a Capitol Police officer who was assaulted during the mayhem.

title: For Many Jan. 6 Rioters, a Pardon From Trump Wasn’t Enough
summary: Some pardoned rioters have been rearrested. Others returned to poverty and mental health challenges. And many became consumed by resentment and demands for payback.

title: Tim Walz’s 17 Months in Politics Before Ending His Re-election Bid
summary: Mr. Walz drew national notice when Kamala Harris chose him as her running mate. A fraud scandal derailed his bid for re-election as Minnesota’s governor.

title: Homeland Security Steps Up Enforcement in Minneapolis
summary: Kristi Noem, the homeland security secretary, posted a video showing an immigration arrest being made as part of the administration’s announced crackdown.

title: Health Dept. to Freeze $10 Billion in Funding to 5 Democratic States
summary: The funding pause could jeopardize child care and other programs that serve hundreds of thousands of households in California, Colorado, Illinois, Minnesota and New York.

title: Photographing 52 Places to Go in 2026
summary: Every year the New York Times’s Travel desk compiles the 52 places to go. Gabriela Bhaskar visits two locations.

title: Can You Optimize Love?
summary: A group of tech executives, app developers and Silicon Valley philosophers is seeking to streamline the messy matters of the heart.

title: Doug LaMalfa Is Dead: Republican Congressman From California Was 65
summary: Mr. LaMalfa had represented a district in northeastern California since 2013.

title: Kennedy Set to Release New Nutrition Guidelines
summary: He has promised a major shake-up of the Dietary Guidelines for Americans. Here’s what experts are watching for.

title: Facing Challenge From Lander, Dan Goldman Prepares to Defend His Seat
summary: Mr. Goldman, a Democrat from New York City, faces a stiff primary battle that could turn on Gaza and how to fight President Trump.

title: George Conway, a Trump Foe, Changes Home and Party to Run for Congress
summary: The former conservative has moved from the Washington suburbs to Manhattan and will run for an open House seat in a heavily Democratic district.

title: Swiss Bar Hit by Deadly Fire Was Not Inspected for Six Years, Authorities Say
summary: Officials in Crans-Montana, the Swiss alpine resort town where a bar fire killed 40 people last week, are facing growing accusations of lax oversight.

title: European Leaders Meet for Latest Round of Ukraine Talks
summary: The discussions, also attended by top U.S. negotiators and other allies of Ukraine, are intended to make progress on European commitments to postwar security if a cease-fire is reached.

title: Optimism About Nuclear Energy Is Rising Again. Will It Last?
summary: Companies like Kairos Power are building new types of reactors with the encouragement of the Trump administration, but their success is far from assured.

title: Trump Is Falling for a Trap We Can All See Coming
summary: Trump’s increasing belligerence abroad should raise alarm about more than the fate of Venezuela.

title: 5 Years After Jan. 6, Lawlessness Has Triumphed
summary: Tragically, America is still living in a political era that began on Jan. 6, 2021.

title: American Federation of Teachers Sues Texas Over Educators’ Comments on Charlie Kirk
summary: The lawsuit challenges a conservative effort to punish those who criticized Mr. Kirk in the aftermath of his killing.

title: Bela Tarr, Titan of Slow-Moving Cinema, Dies at 70
summary: The master Hungarian filmmaker’s movies included “Satantango” and “Werckmeister Harmonies.”

title: Why Israel Is Divided Over How to Investigate Oct. 7 Failures
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has proposed a commission with members chosen in a way that departs from existing law.

title: Will Welch to Leave GQ After 7 Years as Its Top Editor
summary: Mr. Welch worked to move the men’s magazine away from what he called “manly-man tropes.” His next role will be with Pharrell, the men’s designer of Louis Vuitton.
